page.title: 04 Transport in Cwmbran
page.content: The main forms of transport operating on the roads in the grid are cars and buses. There are 21 bus routes operated by one company, National Welsh, which has a large depot in Cwmbran. THe majority of children in the school have a car at home, but most walk to school. Behind our school, and running the full lenght of the grid, is "Cwmbran Drive". This road is under construction, and has meant disruption in the village with clouds of dust and noise descending on our school. This road has followed the disused railway line and resulted in the desruction of the canal in Cwmbran. It is being built to take away the traffic from the main centre of the town.
